headline: Duke Energy Beats 2025 EPS Guidance and Extends Growth Outlook Through 2030
summary: Duke Energy delivered adjusted earnings of $6.31 per share in 2025, exceeding guidance and extending its long-term growth outlook through 2030 on the back of regulated capital investment and rising electricity demand.

headline: Duke Energy: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The results missed Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of six analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.51 per share. The electric utility posted revenue of $7.94 billion in the period, exceeding Street forecasts.

headline: Duke Energy Balances Dividend Appeal With Growing Renewable Investment Focus
summary: Duke Energy (NYSE:DUK) is highlighting its role as a dividend-focused utility while increasing its mix of renewable and cleaner energy projects. The company is emphasizing a balanced approach between its existing regulated power assets and new energy transition investments. This development is drawing attention from investors who prioritize steady income and are interested in lower carbon energy exposure. Duke Energy is a large regulated utility that supplies electricity and related...
